title: Cannot find libcaffe2_gpu.so
body_html:
• PyTorch or Caffe2: Caffe2
  • OS: Ubuntu 16.04
  • How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): source
  • Python version: 2.7
  • CUDA/cuDNN version: cuda 8, Cudnn 6
  • GPU models and configuration: GTX 1080
  • GCC version (if compiling from source): 5.4
  • CMake version: 3.5.1
  • Build command you used (if compiling from source): from caffe2.python import core (inside Python)
  • Versions of any other relevant libraries:
    I ran the code inside python and I got the following:
WARNING:root:This caffe2 python run does not have GPU support. Will run in CPU only mode.
WARNING:root:Debug message: libcaffe2_gpu.so: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
CRITICAL:root:Cannot load caffe2.python. Error: libcaffe2.so: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory

I have added libcaffe2_gpu.co in the LD_LIBRARY_PATH but it's still giving me the warning). Can someone help?

I ran the code inside python and I got the following:

CRITICAL:root:Cannot load caffe2.python. Error: libcaffe2.so: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory

body:
- PyTorch or Caffe2: Caffe2
- OS: Ubuntu 16.04
- How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): source
- Python version: 2.7
- CUDA/cuDNN version: cuda 8, Cudnn 6
- GPU models and configuration: GTX 1080
- GCC version (if compiling from source): 5.4
- CMake version: 3.5.1
- Build command you used (if compiling from source): from caffe2.python import core (inside Python)
- Versions of any other relevant libraries:
I ran the code inside python and I got the following:
```
WARNING:root:This caffe2 python run does not have GPU support. Will run in CPU only mode.
WARNING:root:Debug message: libcaffe2_gpu.so: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
CRITICAL:root:Cannot load caffe2.python. Error: libcaffe2.so: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
```
I have added `libcaffe2_gpu.co` in the `LD_LIBRARY_PATH` but it's still giving me the warning). Can someone help?
